snippet: A lawsuit filed in federal court in Minnesota seeks to undermine union rights.
abstract: Editorial disputes lawsuit filed in Minnesota by the National Right to Work Legal Defense Foundation in attempt to weaken union of 27,000 home care workers there; rejects suit's claims that principal of exclusive representation, central to all labor unions, violates rights of non-union workers; holds absence of strong unions keeps home care and other service workers vulnerable to low wages; warns Supreme Court's conservative majority wants to help keep it that way.
lead_paragraph: A lawsuit filed in federal court in Minnesota seeks to undermine union rights.

headline.main: More Hurdles for Home Care Unions
headline.print_headline: More Hurdles for Home Care Unions

keywords.value: National Right to Work Legal Defense Foundation
keywords.name: organizations
